review text:
We tried so many things that did not work with my 6 month old aczema. It kept coming back even after the prescribed creams. We used this for 3 days so far and have amazing results that we noticed immediately after the first use.
I highly recommend trying this. Everyone is different for sure but this one is definitely worth trying!
I'll update if anything changes.

review name: Reddened baby face-- and includes sunflower oil!
review text:
I really wanted this to work. My baby has some combo of cradle cap/eczema on his forehead, but either way, this only seemed to make it redder. I tried it twice before bed over the course of a week-- and his skin just looked more irritated. My Dr recommended mineral oil and after a month of avoiding it (because petroleum product), I finally used food grade (no fragrance) mineral oil last night after baby's bath. His skin looks 10 times better this morning. I guess there is a reason why it's considered the holy grail-- and there is a ton of misinformation about it online.

Another strike against this product is that it includes sunflower oil, which a respected 2016 study found disrupted the ability of newborn's skin to form its protective barrier. See: Cooke A, Cork MJ, Victor S, Campbell M, Danby S, Chittock J, Lavender T. Olive Oil, Sunflower Oil or no Oil for Baby Dry Skin or Massage: A Pilot, Assessor-blinded, Randomized Controlled Trial (the Oil in Baby SkincaRE [OBSeRvE] Study). Acta Derm Venereol. 2015 Nov 9

review name: Only lotion that is working for my baby’s eczema
review text: I have tried everything from aveeno to cerave to aquaphore to coconut oil to many obscure brands for my baby’s eczema. The stelatopia line is the only thing that is working. I’ve notice this lotion stays in place very well and is thick. I cut open the tube at the end to use up all the lotion. Clearly try the cheaper lotions first given you’ll be using a lot of this stuff but if those don’t work, this might be it.

review name: This is great stuff for my baby
review text:
I have had a great experience with this product. This product lasts a long time dispite it being a smaller bottle. Burns a little if the eczema has created open sores. Buy a face cream with 2% oatmeal to heal that first. And I recommend keeping your little ones fingernails low. And I also bought some FACE wipes for sensitive skin at Meijer (Dove and Water wipes) since I'm feeding him solid foods now and some fuzz on his clothes stick to his face.Good luck fellow parent xoxoxo ❤️

Update: Ended up using cortisone cream from the dollar store and that works the best. It's not a petroleum and it's the cheapest, go figure!

review name: Irritated skin; great customer service from Mustela
review text:
This made my poor baby’s face break out with a red, bumpy rash. I heard good things about this French company, so I thought I’d try this product for my baby’s eczema.

Unfortunately, it seemed to make his skin worse. It cleared up within 24 hours after we stopped using the cream.

Although this didn’t work as planned, I do appreciate Amazon/Mustela accepting my return. The package states that it’s gentle for even the most sensitive skin, which wasn’t the case here.

The company stood behind its product (which is rare); this gives me confidence that this particular cream probably does work for most other babies.

Once I can pinpoint specific ingredients that irritate my baby’s skin, I’m happy to return to the Mustela brand to try other products that might work better... this is all because of some really good customer service.

I have many allergies with allergic dermatitis around my eyes. So I got this due to its all natural gentle ingredients and that it can be used on eyelids. Well, it burned and made my rash so much worse that I had to get prescription strength hydrocortisone and go on Prednisone to get it to clear up.

review name: Not Just for the Wee Ones
review text: I bought this to use on my face, hoping to find a more affordable replacement for Dr. Jart Ceramidin cream. Boy, did it deliver!! I apply at the end of my multi-step skincare routine, after serum and/or face oils, sealing in their benefits and moisturizing effects. It dries smooth on my skin, leaving a matte finish that never feel cakey or dry. It’s wonderful on its own, or as a priming layer under makeup. I’ll always keep this in stock!

This is my second purchase for this item. Originally, I bought it for my daughter's eczema on her face and it worked great. This is my go to whenever she has flareups (anywhere, not just her face). I'd rather use this since I was to avoid steroid use. It usually clears it up within a day or so.
I have had dry, peeling, cracked skin on my nose and chin for many years. I have tried numerous creams and lotions over the years to no avail, to include hydrocortisone prescriptions. One day I decided to give this cream a try and almost all of the dry skin ended up peeling off as soon as the product touched my skin. Two days later, my nose and chin are soft and smooth and the dry skin is gone.

This product is a MUST for parents of little ones with eczema. we had tried EVERYTHING short ofsteroids, but nothing worked. Bathtime always ended in tears and our little one's skin was so red and scaly. This product - combined with the brand's bath oil - soothed and softened his skin IN ONE USE! I'm blown away by the product's effectiveness. Bathtime is now fun again!!!

review name: Works well, smooth and scent free!
review text: I have been using the cream on my little ones eczema patch for about a month. Helped to clear it up and also use it to moisturize her face during this cold season and dry season. Cream works great, no scent noticeable and smooth cream. We like it! Works well too! Definitely worth it to keep my little one smooth!

Best product out there for eczema! My 2 year old has bad eczema all over his body in red patches small and big, all over his ears around his eyes , neck, etc. You name he has it. This has been the only product that he has not scratched his skin. And even after first time use you will notice the difference right away.

review name: A review for adult facial skin
review text: I bought this for use on my face. It contains good ingredients and does help with dryness/irritation/redness, HOWEVER, it balls up. Even if you don't put anything else underneath or on top of this cream, if you just rub your fingers across the skin after the cream has absorbed, it balls up. For this reason, I can't use this cream.

My daughter had such dry, red cheeks. I swear by this brand and am not disappointed by this product! We use it every night before my daughter goes to bed and it helps more than anything else we have tried.
We are a Mustela family through and through!
I find this works better than the face cream for sensitive skin. This one is thicker and when used with the toner it worked wonders for my baby’s acne. I even use it for my face.

review name: Way to expensive. This is travel size.
review text: For nearly $14 this is why you get. It’s my fault I didn’t read the Fl OZ I was assuming it would be larger for the price. It also doesn’t smell like anything. I heard great things about this so I am going to use it in my newborn who has rough patches but overall but loving the scent, size or the prices for these products.

This is the only creamer i use for my baby at night to prevent eczema. I use this regularly to my baby but only at night because when I tried to use it at day for her, it was not effective. My baby’s face became drier but when I used it at night for her, my baby’s face is softer when she wakes up.
Purchased for our sons baby acne after reading about it on several blogs via Pinterest. It worked great at getting rid of his baby acne and it did not dry his face out at all.

It is a bit expensive, and the amount is small that is true. But it works, and it works fast. My son's poor red flaky skin improved after just one application and looked almost normal again after a few days. I am so pleased I decided to give Mustela a try.

The actual product is ok, moisturizing but gave my baby acne, after I stopped using it cleared right up! The size of the product is like a trial size... something you should get for free not pay $13 for! Pretty much disappointing on all fronts.

I rearly write product reviews but this cream does miracles. Within a day it turned my baby's face from red, dry and rashed to beautiful and smooth.
I was getting desperate my baby had what appeared as rash, craddle cap and baby acne at the same time. With this product all gone. Thank uou Mustela!
This was a baby saver. Our baby girl had bad cradle cap and this helped so much. Thank god for my wife doing so much research. This helped clear up her head in about a week. Will def buy again.
Alternating this and hydrocortisone really cleared up my baby's eczema, can't say which one helped more. Doesn't have a strong scent and not at all irritating to sensitive skin.

review name: It cleared my babys face up
review text: I love the Mustella cream on his face which works very well for his eczema. There is no scent and his face is clear. I used it everyday and it took about 2 weeks to clear.
Esta crema la he usado para mi hijo hace mucho tiempo. Y todavía continuo comprándola. Esta marca es excelente para el mejor cuidado de nuestros hijos.
Nothing else helps keep my little one's eczema at bay like this used with the cleansing water. We've tried the Aveeno baby eczema line and this stuff works way better for us.
This was great for my daughter’s cradle cap. Also cleared up some eczema on my face!! It’s a little pricey but worth it.
Not sure if this product is that good or overrated. It’s pricey and I feel like Aveeno does the same job or even better.

I do love this product, which saved my babies rashy red skin, but i dont understand the cost since all other Mustela products come in larger sizes. Still glad i tried it. Wish a larger size for same-ish price
Amazon has this tiny tube prices as much as the 6 oz tube, which is what we thought we were getting. Buy elsewhere. The product is great and works.

review name: Sensitive great product - can be used on whole family
review text: No scent - with daily use fights dry skin and red spots - both of my kids have sensitive faces - this has improved their skin

This product is a must have ! My son dry skin got well with few time using this product.

My baby got eczema on his face and I research all kinds of face cream then decided to buy this because of its high ratings. But this doesn't work at all, even more, my baby will cry and try to escape every time i put the cream on his face.
I bought this to use on my very sensitive adult face skin. It works very well. It is moisturizing without being greasy.

review name: This is an absolute "must" for sensitive dry skin!
review text: This product is a life saver for eczema prone skin. I can moisturize without fear of breakout.

My son had horribly dry skin on his forehead and in his eyebrows. I tried so many things including a beeswax and coconut oil mixture however nothing seemed to help. After using this for 3 days morning and night, you never could tell he had an issue a couple days prior.
I bought it for my baby but I started to use it too :) it’s great

Love it! Love it! Love it! It was amazing for my newborn skin with eczema! It helped moisturize and clear the dry patches. And you can see that after it dries leaves a coat on the skin to prevent dryness!
Cleared up eczema like nothing else. Highly recommend.
Highly recommended facial cream. Moisturizer and absorbs quickly. I use it on a mature skin and gets excellent results.
my baby girl has very sensitive and dry skin, these creams have helped her too much
I received an expired item...I wonder it’s not working. I’m so sorry for my baby for not checking it. I really don’t even think amazon sending expired item.
There is no scent because it’s for sensitive skin. I love all Mustela products!
My baby face cleared up in 2 days!! I love it! She has red dry skin and lots of bumps even on her ears in 2 day days it was all gone. This is a great lotion! Definitely recommend it.

This is an amazing product for babies reddened cheeks. The redness goes away after just a few applications! I can’t believe I found this product. I’ll be recommending it to all my friends with babies :)

excellent

review name: Steroid-free option for anyone with eczema, baby or not
review text: Steroids like hydrocortisone cream can damage skin over time, even the over-the-counter strength ones. I have occasional horrible eczema flare-ups on my hands due to sun exposure or allergies, and I try to keep steroids to a minimum to avoid the negative effects. This is a really soothing alternative to cortisone cream. I find it just about as effective as my beloved Aveeno eczema therapy, so I alternate them to get the effects of both. If you have eczema, give this a try to reduce your steroid use.

I thought this was going to be similar to the zinc oxide cream used for diaper rash. But in actuality, it's just a simple, lightweight moisturizer. It looks and feels very greasy upon initial application, but it absorbs quickly. I tried it on my hands and wouldn't describe it as ultra-hydrating but it is very soothing. Most impressive, though, is that not only does it lack added fragrance, but it doesn't have any scent at all. Not even the vaguely chemical scent you find in many perfume-free skincare products. Literally, moments after applying this, I couldn't smell any sort of lingering aroma on my hands. They just smelled clean. For that alone, I'd say this would be very appropriate for its intended use on infant's skin.

My son has super sensitive skin... I liked this as it was gentle enough to put on his face and neck... Sometimes gets agitation from the clothes he wears where it causes rash or rough skin or from the food he eats or from the pillow he snuggles with. The lotion is not oily or greasy and super light. This absorbed into his skin immediately and it did not cause agitation. I applied this to his face before he went to sleep so his drool wouldn't irritate his skin and it worked wonderfully.

review name: Full of Wonderful Ingredients and Free from Bad Ones
review text:
This is one of the gentlest products that is gentle enough to be used on the face and even around the eyes.

It’s an amazing product filled with wonderful ingredients and free from bad ones.

Mustela’s Stelatopia Emollient Face Cream is composed of 97% plant-based ingredients, including:
Sunflower Oil Distillate
Avocado Perseose
Licorice extract
Shea Butter
Ceramides

Our specially formulated emollient face cream is:
Mineral-oil-free
Paraben-free
Phthalate-free
Phenoxyethanol-free
Steroid-free
Hypoallergenic: specially formulated to minimize the risk of allergic reactions
Tested under pediatric and dermatological control

Even though I ordered this face cream in error, it is for babies with eczema, it works well for me. It is made with all natural products, licorice, Shea butter, daffodil and avocado oil. It is smooth and rich with no discernible scent.

I used some of the cream on my feet after I washed them, they tend to get flaky and dry in the winter. I placed white socks on my feet over the ream.my feet were warm and moisturized. I also use the cream on my neck and my shoulders. It has been very cold this year, with dry air, and this cream is as rich as it gets. A little baby’s face would do well with this cream.

Recommended. prisrob 02-18-19

My baby has very sensitive skin, and I'm always careful about what creams I put on his face to moisturize his often-dry cheeks. His skin has reacted poorly to many brands in the past. But this Mustela face cream works wonders. It moisturizes the dry patches, it isn't greasy, and it disappears completely. It works so well and he's never had a problem with it. It basically feels like a lightweight moisturizer but it does the work of a heavy duty one.

review name: Good for Acne Prone Skin as Well
review text: Lately I've been having a bout of acne due to food allergies. Though it's made for babies, I found it actually helps clear up my skin. The formula is lightweight, non-greasy and is readily absorbed by my skin with no leftover residue. It's made in France of high quality ingredients so I'm very pleased with it. The tube is small and it's pricey for what you get but it's worth it.

review name: Not just for the little ones in your home
review text:
Mustela Stelatopia Emollient Face Cream.
I use this for myself.
Have a condition on my hands that if I use too much hot water I break out.
So much so to the point in the past I have had to get steroid creme to get it back in shape.
Now though I use this product instead if I feel it getting to that point.
Really helps my hands not to get so irritated.
Only need a little bit to get great coverage with this one.
Is a must have in my home now.

I have heard good things about mustela lotions from other moms. They seem to be a good brand, but a little too pricey for me. I tend to use more natural things like shea butter and coconut oil, but this seems to be a good lotion for sensitive skin. It felt good on my hands. It is also unscented which is nice.

This face cream soothes and protects irritated skin. It's hypoallergenic and contains avocado perseose, a concentrate of perseitol and mannoheptulose sugars that protects infants' skin by supporting its natural functions.

The 40 ml or 1.3 fl. oz. tube is small and the value is typical of the many high quality skin care products found in French pharmacies. The expiration date for the tube that I received is well over two years from receipt.

review name: God cream that will bring some relief to baby’s skin
review text: This going on very nicely on my son’s face. It is slightly shiny when first out on but not too greasy. My son’s face is extremely dry this winter so this, more on the natural end cream, comes in very handy. It doesn’t burn him nor bother him. He didn’t get any type of reactions from it or allergies. It seems to make his face softer and puts in more moisture, however I wouldn’t say that it is a solution for dry skin, more so temporary relief.

Although this is marketed for baby's face, I am using it on a patch of eczema on my arm and a little rash on my granddaughter's knee. Although it doesn't clear the rashes, it is making both of our issues less troublesome.

It is a gentle cream that is highly moisturizing without being greasy. It is quick absorption and keep our skin moisturized for hours so it doesn't need to be applied repeatedly throughout the day.

This is a plant based emollient face cream for babies, but I am using it. Adults can use it too. It is especially good for red, dry or rashy skin. No petrolatum or mineral oil or parabens. This definitely moisturizes skin without being greasy. This soaks in nicely. This is unscented too, so if you have allergies you would probably be able to use it. I am glad it does not bother my allergies. Made in France, the is high quality.

I really liked Mustela Stelatopia - Emollient Baby Face Cream - For Eczema-Prone Skin - with Natural Avocado & Cera. It worked really well. Works great. Non irritating. Fragrance is very natural smelling. I'm happy with this. I would definitely recommend this.

review name: Excellent product to help treat eczema
review text: My son is prone to eczema--particularly on one side of his leg--so we have been applying this daily (for over a month now) to the area and it really does seem to soothe his skin and reduce the inflammation. I'm really impressed with this product. I like that it is fragrance free and made with natural ingredients. Highly recommended! Thank you!

review name: Wonderful for eczema relief, not just for babies or faces!
review text: I have some nearly permanent eczema areas on my ankles. Not a baby and it’s not my face....but this cream is the best at soothing and moisturizing my itrritated areas. It isn’t greasy at all and is very soothing. It just about eliminates the itch of eczema. I think it works very well and cuts down my use of steroid creams. Handy tube size.

This cream is supposed to go on your face, but it smells so strong that I don't want it near my face. And, I really didn't find it all that moisturizing either. I had to go over it with a better quality moisturizer. I think it's too pricey for what you get.

This great lotion. It goes on thick and smooth and absorbs completely. It leaves the skin soft and helps with the eczema outbreaks and after a few days the skin is completely back to normal. It has a very discreet scent that is barely noticeable. Overall, it's great facial lotion.

review name: Not just for babies ... works great on kids, teens, and adults.
review text: My son struggles with eczema on his face, so we try to keep it under control with the least amount of medicine. This works great at keeping the skin moisturized, and slowing down the irritation when it starts to flare. I recommend this as one option in your first line of defense.

I like this cream, it is easily applied and helps my daughter's eczema. I have tried many different things to ease her discomfort and nothing really worked. This is the first thing that I have used that I feel is really helping to heal.

My 5 month old has been battling really bad eczema on her cheeks and i have used everything! Aveeno products, aquafor, vaseline, coconut oil, & hydrocortisone and her eczema just kept coming back. Until i read about Mutsela, it is an alternative for hydrocortisone cream and works like magic and it smells amazing! I am so grateful for this product it works instantly! 10/10 definitely recommend.

review name: Left our toddler with fine bumps all over
review text: We’ve used the micellar water, love hydra Bebe. We tried this one because our local Target ran out. Our kiddo already suffers from eczema but once we used this cream, it broke him out in hives. Definitely returning.

I used this on my face on a whim this winter and found out that not only is it great for my baby, but it’s excellent for my dry flaky skin - AND it doubles as a makeup primer that leaves my foundation looking great. Love this!

This is a very good moisturizing cream. It is meant for a baby’s face but I am using this on my hands and neck – works great – it’s not too greasy but very moisturizing. The ingredients are natural & it is unscented. This is made in France.

review name: It's very gentle. No adverse effects. Very neutral.
review text: I use this on her face when she gets a little breakout and it seems to help. It's very gentle. No adverse effects. Very neutral.
Nice face cream. I applied it last night after washing my face and it felt good going on--not too dry and not too wet. I will be using this every night.
Gentle but very moisturizing. Helps with chapped skin.

Took some time to review this as I wanted to make sure it worked. It seems to be the only cream that’s effectively controlled our little ones eczema. It’s pricey but worked well.

We tried regular baby lotion, eucerin, aquaphor and even some prescription lotion.

review name: Need improvement for the packing, not user friendly, cream is good
review text: Doesn’t smell, work good on my baby skin. The only reason I give three start is because the package tube is so hard to get the product out. I have the cut the tube open and get the cream out and put in a container to use it! Also when I squeeze it, the back part of the packaging opens! And cream cake out from the back......... need some improvement on the packaging! Cream is good tho

The tube was small sized and convenient to use. This cream was scentless (which I actually preferred since I'm sensitive to strong fragrances) and gentle on my very dry skin. It was slightly greasy but absorbed very quickly. It didn't irritate my skin, and I found it to be hydrating and light weight.
